Package icyllis.arc3d.engine

Class GpuTexture

java.lang.Object
icyllis.arc3d.engine.GpuResource
icyllis.arc3d.engine.GpuTexture
All Implemented Interfaces:
RefCounted, IGpuSurface, ISurface
Direct Known Subclasses:
GLTexture, VulkanTexture
public abstract class GpuTexture extends GpuResource implements IGpuSurface
Represents 2D textures can be sampled by shaders, can also be used as attachments of render targets.

By default, a Texture is not renderable, all mipmaps (including the base level) are dirty. But it can be renderable on creation, then we call it a RenderTexture or TextureRenderTarget. The texture will be the main color buffer of the single sample framebuffer of the render target. So we can cache these framebuffers with texture. Additionally, it may create more surfaces and attach them to it. These surfaces are budgeted but cannot be reused. In most cases, we reuse textures, so these surfaces are reused together, see GpuRenderTarget.

    • isReadOnly

      public final boolean isReadOnly()
      The pixel values of this surface cannot be modified (e.g. doesn't support write pixels or mipmap regeneration). To be exact, only wrapped textures, external textures, stencil attachments and MSAA color attachments can be read only.
      Returns:
      true if pixels in this surface are read-only

    • isProtected

      public final boolean isProtected()
      Returns:
      true if we are working with protected content

    • getSurfaceFlags

      public final int getSurfaceFlags()
      Surface flags, but no render target level flags.
      • ISurface.FLAG_BUDGETED - Indicates whether an allocation should count against a cache budget. Budgeted when set, otherwise not budgeted. GpuTexture only.
      • ISurface.FLAG_MIPMAPPED - Used to say whether a texture has mip levels allocated or not. Mipmaps are allocated when set, otherwise mipmaps are not allocated. GpuTexture only.
      • ISurface.FLAG_RENDERABLE - Used to say whether a surface can be rendered to, whether a texture can be used as color attachments. Renderable when set, otherwise not renderable.
      • ISurface.FLAG_PROTECTED - Used to say whether texture is backed by protected memory. Protected when set, otherwise not protected.
      • ISurface.FLAG_READ_ONLY - Means the pixels in the texture are read-only. GpuTexture only.
      Specified by:
      getSurfaceFlags in interface IGpuSurface
      Returns:
      combination of the above flags

    • asTexture

      public GpuTexture asTexture()
      Description copied from interface: IGpuSurface
      If this object is texture, returns this.

      If this object is framebuffer, returns the associated color buffer 0 if available, or null (only OpenGL can return null).

      Specified by:
      asTexture in interface IGpuSurface
      Returns:
      raw ptr to the texture

    • isMipmapsDirty

      public final boolean isMipmapsDirty()
      Return true if mipmaps are dirty and need to regenerate before sampling. The value is valid only when isMipmapped() returns true.
      Returns:
      whether mipmaps are dirty

      public void setReleaseCallback(@SharedPtr ReleaseCallback callback)

    • onDiscard

      protected void onDiscard()
      Description copied from class: GpuResource
      Subclass should override this method to invalidate any internal handles, etc. to backend API resources. This may be called when the underlying 3D context is no longer valid and so no backend API calls should be made.
      Specified by:

    • computeScratchKey

      @Nullable protected GpuTexture.ScratchKey computeScratchKey()
      Description copied from class: GpuResource
      Called by the registerWithCache if the resource is available to be used as scratch. Resource subclasses should override this if the instances should be recycled as scratch resources and populate the scratchKey with the key. By default, resources are not recycled as scratch.
      Overrides:
      computeScratchKey in class GpuResource
